articles.title: JANUARY, 1972
articles.summary: This document lists the elected officers for January 1972, including the President, Vice-President, Secretary, and Treasurer. Each officer's name and phone number are provided, indicating current leadership for the organization during that month.

articles.title: JANUARY MEETING
articles.summary: The January meeting is scheduled for Friday, January 7, at 8 p.m. at Community Bank. The agenda includes a talk by Jerry Rattley on "Double Stars" and a discussion by Greg Nichols about the planet "Pluto," with Rattley also prepared to answer questions on visual binaries.

articles.title: STARPARTY
articles.summary: A star party is scheduled for December 18 at the SJAA Site. Dave is coordinating this event, which is highlighted as the only star party for December, and his contact number is provided for coordination.

articles.title: PLANNING MEETING # January 14, 8 p.m.
articles.summary: This document announces a planning meeting scheduled for January 14 at 8 p.m. The meeting will take place at Jerry Rattley's residence in Milpitas, California, with a detailed map and a contact number provided for attendees who might get lost.

articles.title: ANOTHER ROOM-PACKED MORRISON LECTURE
articles.summary: Dr. David Cudaback delivered a well-attended Morrison Lecture titled "High Altitude Astronomy" at West Valley College, attracting nearly seventy astronomers. He introduced current frontiers in astronomy, highlighting the significant challenges of observing celestial phenomena through Earth's atmosphere. Cudaback used slides to illustrate how current ground-based observations capture only a small fraction of the universe's total energy.

articles.title: Page 2
articles.summary: Dr. David Cudaback delivered a talk detailing the selection of White Mountain as the driest area in the U.S. for astronomical observations, particularly focusing on millimeter-wavelength astronomy, which is hindered by water vapor. He discussed ongoing meteorological measurements, viewing determinations, and initial instrument plans for the site. The lecture concluded with a lively Q&A session covering various astronomical topics.

articles.title: OCCULTATION - DECEMBER 29th
articles.summary: An upcoming lunar occultation, described as the best graze of the year, is scheduled for December 29th in Wasco, California. The event will occur at dusk, with the star occulting a 90% lit moon, and observers are advised to use a 2.4-inch telescope along with a tape recorder and 5 MHz radio receiver. Dave Ambrose is coordinating the 4:30 p.m. event.

articles.title: NEW ADDRESS
articles.summary: This document announces Trudy Ball's new address in New York City. Her new residence is YMCA-Morgan Hall #727, located at 132 E. 45th St., NY, NY 10017.

articles.title: SEND YOUR ARTICLES OR PHOTOS
articles.summary: Lee Cameron, Editor/Publisher of the new magazine "Amateur Skies," is soliciting articles and photos for publication. A complimentary issue will be available for perusal at the January meeting, where the Astronomic Association of Northern California (AANC) will also vote on their new By-laws.

articles.title: FOR SALE:
articles.summary: An individual named Tom Curtis is selling a 3-inch refractor telescope. The package includes 15 eyepieces (compatible with 1Â¼" or 25.4mm), a custom-made spectroscope, and an equatorial mount with clutch and clock drive. The asking price is $300.00 or best offer, with contact details provided for inquiries.

articles.title: WINTER CALENDAR
articles.summary: This document outlines a 'WINTER CALENDAR' detailing astronomical events and meetings from December through May. It lists star parties at the SJAA Site, observing events like an occultation, and regular meetings featuring talks on diverse topics such as double stars, Pluto, optics, astrophotography, and lasers, alongside planning meetings hosted by members.

articles.title: NEW LIBRARIAN
articles.summary: Bruce Smith has moved to Palo Alto, prompting a change in the library's directorship. Dave Ambrose has been appointed as the new librarian for the organization. Concurrently, a new and more convenient library site has been selected at 1755 El Codo Way, San Jose.

articles.title: NEW BULLETIN EDITOR
articles.summary: Dave Dickson is announced as the new bulletin editor, with Mary assisting as associate editor, and the bulletin's new location will be 4112 Camden Ave, San Jose. The previous editor, Dick Glasspool, expresses gratitude to all contributors, especially Barbara Glasspool, for their support over the past year.
